original: Blomström, Harry Thorvald Emanuel, överläkare, Mösseberg, f. 18/7/ 96 i Sthlm av red. Olof B. o. Wilhelmina Sjöberg. G. 31 m. Greta Svensson. Barn: Ake f. 31, Ingrid 34, Ann-Marie 36, Folke 38, Ragnar 42. — Studiex. 15, inskriv, v. Karol. inst. 17, m^ed. kand. där 21 o. m.ed. äc. där 26. E. läk. v. Loka brunn 22, assist :läk. v. Maria sjukh. med. avd. 25-26, vik. undiläk. v. röntg:avd. där 26, dito samt e. läk. v. dess med. avd. 26-28, und:läk. där 28-31, e. läk. där 31-32, överläk. o. intend. v. Mössebergs sa-nat. sed. 32. Batiläk. i Fik res. 26. Skr.: ett 15-tal skr., spec. betr. kliniken o. diagnostiken v. leversjukd.
translated: Blomström, Harry Thorvald Emanuel, senior physician, Mösseberg, born on July 18, 1896 in Stockholm to editor Olof B. and Wilhelmina Sjöberg. Married in 1931 to Greta Svensson. Children: Ake (born in 1931), Ingrid (born in 1934), Ann-Marie (born in 1936), Folke (born in 1938), Ragnar (born in 1942). He completed his high school studies in 1915, enrolled at the Karolinska Institute in 1917, completed his medical degree there in 1921, and gained his academic degree in 1926. He worked as a medical doctor at Loka Brunn in 1922, as an assistant physician at Maria Hospital's medical ward from 1925 to 1926, as a resident physician at the hospital's radiology department in 1926, and as a medical doctor at the medical ward from 1926 to 1928. He was appointed as an attending physician there from 1928 to 1931, and as a medical doctor from 1931 to 1932. He went on to become the senior physician and superintendent at Mössebergs sanatorium in 1932. He served as a battalion physician in Fik in 1926. He wrote about 15 articles on clinical medicine and diagnostics of liver diseases.

article.name: Clinical Medicine and Diagnostics of Liver Diseases
